meanings.definition: Determined to achieve something at all costs.
meanings.sent1: She was hellbent on winning the race no matter what.
meanings.sent2: He is always hellbent on finishing his homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was hellbent on getting the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The detective was hellbent on solving the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The warrior was hellbent on protecting his kingdom from invaders.

meanings.definition: Moving at a high speed or with great force.
meanings.sent1: The car sped down the highway hellbent on reaching its destination.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds moved hellbent across the sky, bringing heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride was hellbent, making everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed hellbent towards the waterfall, creating a powerful rush of water.
meanings.sent5: The rocket launched into space hellbent, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she remained hellbent on achieving her dream.
meanings.sent2: The old man was hellbent on following his daily routine without any changes.
meanings.sent3: The cat was hellbent on catching the elusive red dot on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The toddler was hellbent on carrying his oversized teddy bear everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The student was hellbent on getting the highest grade in the class.
